ver_20120624/Twitter/basic_auth.py

00001 import tweepy
00002 
00003 # === Basic Authentication ===
00004 #
00005 # *Note: Basic Authentication is deprecated and no longer supported on Twitter.
00006 #      It is still provided for use in services like Status.net which still suppports it.*
00007 #
00008 # This mode of authentication requires the user provide their username and plain text password.
00009 # These credentials will then be provided for each request to the API for authentication.
00010 
00011 # You would normally fetch this in your application
00012 # by asking the user or loading from some dark place.
00013 username = ""
00014 password = ""
00015 
00016 # Create an authentication handler passing it the username and password.
00017 # We will use this object later on when creating our API object.
00018 auth = tweepy.auth.BasicAuthHandler(username, password)
00019 
00020 # Create the API object providing it the authentication handler to use.
00021 # Each request will then be authenticated using this handler.
00022 api = tweepy.API(auth)
00023 
00024 api.update_status('Updating using basic authentication via Tweepy!')
00025
